AD.content: Levinas: city never this side of the Religious
God defends those who commit involuntary murder from avengers of blood
Levinas’ city of refuge vs. Pirque Aboth’s “men ready to swallow each other alive”

CF.content: audacious call for genuine innovation in history of right and duty of hospitality: city of refuge
city reinvent its relation to sovereignty of State
when State is neither author of nor guarantor against violence forcing refugees to flee—it is powerless to ensure protection/liberty of its own citizens before terrorist threat
right to asylum for stateless peoples (l’apatrides): was ‘the only right that had ever figured as a symbol of Human Rights in the domain of international relations’ [Arendt]
politics of city, a free city, une ville franche, Utopic?
juridical tradition remains ‘mean-minded,’ restrictive, because under control of demographico-economic interests (Nation-State regulating asylum)
to say a country does not offer economic benefit to a refugee (only asylum) [perverse, hypocritical distinction], discourse on asylum risks becoming nothing but pure rhetorical alibis
city of refuge giving place for reflection and for new order of law, democracy to come (if a certain idea of cosmopolitanism has arrived, perhaps one hasn’t recognized it yet)
